cyclone.name: BARRY
cyclone.current_location: about 85 mi SSW of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: slowly drifting west-northwest, then turning northwest and north toward the central Louisiana coast before moving inland up the Lower Mississippi Valley
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the central-southeastern Louisiana coast (around Morgan City, LA)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch and Tropical Storm Watch extend from the mouth of the Mississippi River eastward to the MS/AL border and westward to Cameron LA (no Texas coast included)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane and Tropical-Storm Warnings from Intracoastal City LA to Grand Isle LA and Pearl River mouth (no Texas coast included)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central and southeastern Louisiana coast, Mississippi coast, and adjacent north-central Gulf waters
weather_observation.wind: Only low-end tropical-storm-force gusts (â‰¤39 mph) possible in occasional squalls; overall wind threat minimal
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the middle Texas coast; surge warnings confined east of Cameron LA
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rainbands could bring 1-3 inches with localized higher totals; widespread flooding not expected at the port
weather_observation.other_hazards: Hazardous seas and rip currents across approaches to Matagorda and Lavaca Bays may disrupt pilotage and small-craft operations
